content: you ll attach it to the shoulder piece using a slip_stitch note that you will not slip_stitch into every stitch of the shoulders this will help the wings to curve and sit well against the body work into these stitches of the shoulder only when building the feathers feather 1 chain 7 half_double_crochet 6 down the chain slip_stitch into stitch 3 of the shoulder chain 1 & turn work the starting chain 7 finished feather 1 feather 2 half_double_crochet 6 up the feather chain 2 and turn work hdc1 in 2nd chain from hook then half_double_crochet 6 down the feather slip_stitch into stitch 5 of the shoulder chain 1 & turn work feather 3 half_double_crochet 3 up the feather chain 1 and turn work half_double_crochet 3 down the feather slip_stitch into stitch 7 of the shoulder feather 2 feather 3 chain 4 2 feather 4 half_double_crochet 3 down the chain slip_stitch into stitch 9 of the shoulder chain 1 & turn work feather 4 feather 5 half_double_crochet 3 up the feather chain 5 and turn work half_double_crochet 4 down the chain then half_double_crochet 3 down the feather slip_stitch into stitch 11 of the shoulder chain 1 & turn work chain up 5 after making 3 finished feather 5 hdcs into the feather feather 6 half_double_crochet 6 up the feather chain 1 and turn work half_double_crochet 6 down the feather slip_stitch into stitch 14 of the shoulder finished feather 6 completed wings fasten_off if you are going to sew the wings onto the body leave a long tail for sewing use a needle to weave the end through the edge of the wing and bring it out next to the starting tail note the photo of the completed wings shows the right side of the wing piece which should face outwards on the finished bird **** 3 body the body is worked in continuous spiral rounds using increases and decreases for shaping do not join rounds make sure the right side of the work is facing out the tail is worked in row after stuffing and closing the body important use a stitch marker to keep track of the start of the round a note on shift stitches the start of the round will always shift gradually to the right or left if you crochet left handed when working in continuous rounds to keep the body symmetrical and prevent twisting this pattern requires a shift stitch every few rounds for me this is every 4th round and this is what is written in the pattern however your gauge yarn weight and hook size may mean you need to make a shift stitch more or less often i recommend that the first time you try this pattern you use a running stitch marker to keep track of the centre line body option 1 two piece round 1 chain 2 single_crochet 6 into 2nd chain from hook 6 round 2 increase in each stitch 12 round 3 single_crochet 4 increase single_crochet 2 increase
